programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Use shapes in new ways. Modern Quilt Guild marketing director Heather Grant discusses the modern quilt aesthetic and modern quilt designs. Blogger Rossie Hutchinson joins quilter Elizabeth Dackson to talk about improv quilt events. Instructor Rebecca Kemp Brent uses the latest cutting and quilting technology to create a confetti star quilt design.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela demonstrates the no-waste flying geese method while making a stunning multidimensional quilt for the most "quilt-worthy" person in her life. And she shares her top 3 tips for quilting big quilts on a small machine.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's reminded of her age as she relies on her kids to keep up with the digital world. Watch as she uses two basic shapes to create a mod half-square triangle quilt that's easier to make than it looks.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Advanced doesn't' mean difficult, we are just building on what we learned in the past and adding that next step. Joanne Banko starts with lesson two on zippers – choose the right zipper for the right garment. Then, Angela Wolf is in her studio. Learn basic techniques for bound buttonholes and welt pockets to make them perfectly and professionally.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Evening-wear for men and women offers endless style opportunities. Designer and educator Louis Carney adds glitz and glamor to men's fashions with metallic thread and crystals. Embroidery educator Joanne Banko creates beautiful, Asian-inspired sleepwear with embroidered details and stylish closures.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Connect your designs in new ways. Warm up as host Katie Hacker designs with colorful stones. She adds beads and metal spacers to enhance the stone elements in necklaces. Author Lisa Crone works out with memory wire to create a sparkling necklace. Then, she cools down by making matching earrings.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Express your style in metalwork and with lettering, too. Mary Hettmansperger adds a window in metal work to make a versatile bezel. She adds style by layering metals and putting a variety of motifs behind the window. Creative collaborator Brenda Schweder shares her favorite tips on soldering metalwork. Katie Hacker puts her style into words with lettering in Katie's Beading Lesson.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Guests on this show share ways to celebrate friends and family. First, Kazan Clark creates a magnet board with bottlecaps. Next, Julie interviews Dina Wakley. Then, Stacy Julian shows how to make a family tree album. Last, Julie makes pop up place cards.

programme.title: Make It Artsy
programme.desc: Each and every morning is our chance to re-invent our creativity. At the start of the show, Host Julie Fei Fan Balzer demonstrates a sewn book binding technique. Then, take a new look at the night sky with Cheryl Holtz. Finally, Rita Pannullo adds stamping to premade shapes to create dangles for drink stirrers

programme.title: Shawl Lovers
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Are you Quilt Curious, but unsure where to get started? THIS is the Midnight Quilt Show episode for you!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela ponders on her new year's resolutions as she builds a curved log cabin quilt using ombré fabric.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela demonstrates the no-waste flying geese method while making a stunning multidimensional quilt for the most "quilt-worthy" person in her life. And she shares her top 3 tips for quilting big quilts on a small machine.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: THANK YOU to all of you amazing quilters for supporting this journey and show! Let's take a look back at 2017 and forward to 2018!

programme.title: Baking & Cooking
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Shoot for the stars with this galactic-inspired cake! Join Rachael Teufel as she demonstrates how to create a cake that's out of this world, featuring shimmering wire stars and funky, swirled icing. She'll share her tips for glazing your galaxy cake and using a brush to create cosmic effects in your icing.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Follow along with Rachael Teufel as she shows you how to bring this blossom and butterfly cake to life with vibrant buttercream and modeling chocolate accents. With basic piping techniques and simple butterfly stencils, this cake is great for beginners. Plus, see how Rachael makes a quick and easy drying rack for your modeling chocolate accents.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: We are on the move, with projects that go along with us, or move themselves! Join host Katie Hacker and make a rockin' roadster that really rolls. Artist Franz Spohn uses a little string to add animation to his art and blogger Jenny Barnett Rohrs make a wreath with colorful felt pinwheels. Use the Family Craft Box and recycled denim to make a car track. Decorate your room with an eye-catching string art project that uses color to create the feeling of movement.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Bring the outside inside with a little creativity. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a colorful leafy tree banner. Candie Cooper creates a fish kite and Katie Hacker builds a whimsical woods scene. Then, Jenny decorates a glittery tree to celebrate the holidays.

programme.title: Draw Better Portraits: Capturing Likeness
programme.desc: Learn to draw and paint with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Big Baking Experiment
programme.desc: Learn to bake with CraftsyTV

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela is kicking off Season 7 of the Midnight Quilt Show with a redemption story. She’s made this Thistle quilt pattern before with half-square triangles but thinks this flying-geese version will be much easier to quilt.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: The thing about quilting is there's always room to grow, even for the midnight quilter! This episode's all about reflecting on personal growth. Well, that and how to put a modern spin on a traditional block we all know and love.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela shows you how to make half-square triangles two at a time for a dazzling quilt that's beaming with color.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela whips up a stash-busting table topper using the quilt-as-you-go method Gudrun Erla teaches in her online class "Fast & Furious: Quilt-As-You-Go With Pre-Cuts."

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: As the new century dawned, fashion had gone from corsets to spandex pants in just 100 years. Even dogs were getting dressed up. Paulette Bell creates a customized dog coat using machine embroidery. Angela Wolf adds a hand warmer to work-out wear for today's trendy touch.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Your home reflects who you are. Using an easy smocking technique, sewing enthusiast Cheryl Sleboda makes colorful, patterned pillows to showcase her style. Blogger Heather Valentine combines unusual materials to create a handy caddy for her studio. With hand-dyed wool and nubby fibers, author Lisa Shepard Stewart stitches a lush wall-hanging.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Beat single sock syndrome with a little multitasking! The girls go over how to knit two socks at once so you'll never end up with solo socks again.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: Stacked Increases + FOX PAWS Knitting Pattern
programme.desc: Having trouble with your Fox Paws scarf? Well, you're not the only one! Luckily, designer Xandy is here to share her tips and tricks for navigating her famously intricate pattern.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Patterns are a design, motif or decoration, formed from regular repeated elements. They can also be naturally-occurring or a random arrangement of shapes, colors which have a regular or decorative effect. Patterns can be stripes, or lines, or alternating colors. The first project has a striped pattern of knots tied with plastic lacing. Next, make felt cookies with a polka dot pattern. Then add a chevron pattern to your art journal. Last, create a folding play mat with landscape patterns of a city scene around a lake.

programme.title: Beginners Guide To Manual Mode
programme.desc: Learn photography with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Shoot for the stars with this galactic-inspired cake! Join Rachael Teufel as she demonstrates how to create a cake that's out of this world, featuring shimmering wire stars and funky, swirled icing. She'll share her tips for glazing your galaxy cake and using a brush to create cosmic effects in your icing.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Learn how etching can give your next cake design a uniquely artistic look with Rachael Teufel. She shows you how to prep your cake with layers of colored icing before using an etching tool to carve out and reveal the layers of your icing. Learn her tips for creating smooth, even layers and how to gauge the depth of your icing before you begin etching.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: -George Vondriska shares some essential cabinet making techniques that can be used to craft your own shop storage cabinet. Follow along as he breaks down the intricacies of cabinet making and demonstrates the assembly of the cabinet's body, back panel, face frame, hinges, and plexiglass window.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Be daring and explore free form quilting. Contemporary quilt artist Sylvia Schaefer desconstructs traditional designs and makes them explode into new motifs. Designer Anna Maria Horner throws the rules out the window with free-form appliquÃ© techniques to make bouquet quilts.
